title: expectOutputString() in strict mode not working in 3.6.5
body:
This is followup to bug #371.

When running example test in strict mode, I get two failures.

Test case:

``` php
<?php
class Sample_test extends PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{

public function testExpectFooActualFoo()
{
    $this->expectOutputString('foo');
    print 'foo';
}

public function testExpectBarActualBaz()
{
    $this->expectOutputString('bar');
    print 'baz';
}
}
?>
```

Output:

```
PHPUnit 3.6.5 by Sebastian Bergmann.

FF

Time: 0 seconds, Memory: 6.00Mb

There were 2 failures:

1) Sample_test::testExpectFooActualFoo
This test printed output: foo


2) Sample_test::testExpectBarActualBaz
Failed asserting that two strings are equal.
--- Expected
+++ Actual
@@ @@
-'bar'
+'baz'


FAILURES!
Tests: 2, Assertions: 2, Failures: 2.
```

The first test should not fail.

After applying following fix, it works as expected.

``` patch
--- Framework/TestCase.php.orig 2011-12-20 10:01:40.000000000 +0100
+++ Framework/TestCase.php  2011-12-20 10:02:20.000000000 +0100
@@ -407,8 +407,8 @@
             return FALSE;
         }

-        if ($this->outputExpectedString !== NULL ||
-            $this->outputExpectedRegex !== NULL) {
+        if (is_null($this->outputExpectedString) &&
+            is_null($this->outputExpectedRegex)) {
             return FALSE;
         }

```

Output with patch:

```
PHPUnit 3.6.5 by Sebastian Bergmann.

.F

Time: 0 seconds, Memory: 5.75Mb

There was 1 failure:

1) Sample_test::testExpectBarActualBaz
Failed asserting that two strings are equal.
--- Expected
+++ Actual
@@ @@
-'bar'
+'baz'


FAILURES!
Tests: 2, Assertions: 2, Failures: 1.
```
